Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC) with symmetric configuration have received widespread attention for their potential immunity toward resisting coking and sulfur poisoning.
Titulo: La0.3Sr0.7Ti0.3Fe0.7O3-δ-Based Electrodes for Symmetrical Solid Oxide Fuel Cells by A-Site Deficiency Manipulation

Sentencas: A key requirement for electrodes in the development of symmetric solid oxide fuel cells is the high electrocatalytic activity in both oxidizing and reducing atmospheres.
Titulo: La0.3Sr0.7Ti0.3Fe0.7O3-δ-Based Electrodes for Symmetrical Solid Oxide Fuel Cells by A-Site Deficiency Manipulation

Sentencas: Herein we report a facile method to improve the electrochemical performance of La0.3Sr0.7Ti0.3Fe0.7O3-delta- (LSTF-) based perovskite electrode material by introducing the deficiency in the A-site.
Titulo: La0.3Sr0.7Ti0.3Fe0.7O3-δ-Based Electrodes for Symmetrical Solid Oxide Fuel Cells by A-Site Deficiency Manipulation

Sentencas: X-ray diffraction (XRD) results demonstrated that A-site deficient LSTF exsolves a small amount of Fe0 metallic particles and layer perovskite Sr2TiO4, which exhibits high electrical conductivity in H2 atmosphere, while at the same time the exsolution is reversible.
Titulo: La0.3Sr0.7Ti0.3Fe0.7O3-δ-Based Electrodes for Symmetrical Solid Oxide Fuel Cells by A-Site Deficiency Manipulation

Sentencas: The polarization resistances (Rp) of (La0.3Sr0.7)0.95Ti0.3Fe0.7O3-delta (LSTF-5%) are 0.032 and 0.110 omega cm2 in air and wet H2 (containing 3% H2O), respectively, at 800 degrees C.
Titulo: La0.3Sr0.7Ti0.3Fe0.7O3-δ-Based Electrodes for Symmetrical Solid Oxide Fuel Cells by A-Site Deficiency Manipulation

Sentencas: The power density of the electrolyte-supported SSOFCs with LSTF-5% as symmetrical electrode reaches up to 431.8 mW cm-2 at 800 degrees C in wet H2/air.
Titulo: La0.3Sr0.7Ti0.3Fe0.7O3-δ-Based Electrodes for Symmetrical Solid Oxide Fuel Cells by A-Site Deficiency Manipulation

Sentencas: And the LSTF-5% symmetrical cell also exhibits excellent electrochemical performance and high stability for electrochemically reducing pure CO2.
Titulo: La0.3Sr0.7Ti0.3Fe0.7O3-δ-Based Electrodes for Symmetrical Solid Oxide Fuel Cells by A-Site Deficiency Manipulation

Sentencas: Therefore, LSTF-5% perovskite can act as an excellent electrode material in a symmetrical SOFC.
Titulo: La0.3Sr0.7Ti0.3Fe0.7O3-δ-Based Electrodes for Symmetrical Solid Oxide Fuel Cells by A-Site Deficiency Manipulation

Sentencas: The results in this paper also indicate that an appropriate amount of A-site deficiency on LSTF perovskite can lead to an increase in oxygen vacancy concentration and better electrochemical performance.
Titulo: La0.3Sr0.7Ti0.3Fe0.7O3-δ-Based Electrodes for Symmetrical Solid Oxide Fuel Cells by A-Site Deficiency Manipulation
